cosinnus.api_frontend.serializers package¶

Submodules¶

cosinnus.api_frontend.serializers.dynamic_fields module¶

class cosinnus.api_frontend.serializers.dynamic_fields.CosinnusUserDynamicFieldsSerializerMixin(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: object

Dynamically adds serializer fields for the dynamic userprofile fields to any DRF serializer. (see UserCreationFormDynamicFieldsMixin)

DYNAMIC_FIELD_SETTINGS = None¶
all_fields_optional = False¶
filter_included_fields_by_option_name = None¶
save_dynamic_fields(validated_data, userprofile, save=True)¶

Saves any dynamic fields contained in the validated_data to the userprofile. To be called from within create() or update()

validate(attrs)¶

Validate dynamic fields: we build a temporary formfield and use it to run validation with the given data

cosinnus.api_frontend.serializers.portal module¶

class cosinnus.api_frontend.serializers.portal.CosinnusManagedTagSerializer(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: ModelSerializer

Serializer for the User Login API endpoint

class Meta¶

Bases: object

fields = ('slug', 'name', 'default', 'type', 'description', 'image', 'url', 'search_synonyms', 'group_url')¶
model¶

alias of CosinnusManagedTag

read_only_fields = ('slug', 'name', 'default', 'type', 'description', 'image', 'url', 'search_synonyms', 'group_url')¶
get_default(obj)¶

Return the default value to use when validating data if no input is provided for this field.

If a default has not been set for this field then this will simply raise SkipField, indicating that no value should be set in the validated data for this field.

get_image(obj)¶

cosinnus.api_frontend.serializers.user module¶

class cosinnus.api_frontend.serializers.user.CosinnusHybridUserSerializer(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: TaggitSerializer, CosinnusUserDynamicFieldsSerializerMixin, Serializer

A serializer that accepts and returns user fields as unprefixed fields, no matter if they are in the User, UserProfile or CosinnusTagObject models, so that one doesn’t have to worry about database structures when changing user profile values.

DYNAMIC_FIELD_SETTINGS = {}¶
all_fields_optional = True¶
get_visibility(instance)¶

validate(attrs)¶

Validate dynamic fields: we build a temporary formfield and use it to run validation with the given data

class cosinnus.api_frontend.serializers.user.CosinnusUserSignupSerializer(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: UserSignupFinalizeMixin, CosinnusUserDynamicFieldsSerializerMixin, Serializer

Serializer for the User Registration API endpoint

DYNAMIC_FIELD_SETTINGS = {}¶
create(validated_data)¶

Create a new user as a signup via the API. TODO: should this all run in an atomic block?

filter_included_fields_by_option_name = 'in_signup'¶
validate(attrs)¶

We run validation all in one method, because we do not want to give out any further validation details if the captcha is incorrect

cosinnus.api_frontend.serializers.user.validate_contact_info_pairs(pairs_array)¶

Validates contact info JSON pairs for the frontend API. Used in field UserProfile.dynamic_fields[PROFILE_DYNAMIC_FIELDS_CONTACTS] example: [{type: “email|phone_number|url”, value: “mail@mail.com”}, …]

cosinnus.api_frontend.serializers.utils module¶

cosinnus.api_frontend.serializers.utils.validate_managed_tag_slugs(managed_tag_slugs, at_least_one_tag_required)¶

Check if a given list of managed tag slugs is valid for saving in a form, checking missing, too many and valid managed tags.
